project0.title: Pays Houdanais Cat School Association
project0.titleDescription: Web application for managing animal adoptions
project0.description: The application allows users to browse animals available for adoption, submit adoption requests, and track the status of their applications. It is built with React, Tailwind CSS, and TypeScript.

project1.title: Textile Guide
project1.description: Textile-Guide is a web application developed with React, using Tailwind CSS for styling and TypeScript for robust, typed programming. The application allows users to see which fabrics match which sewing projects (pants, t-shirt, sweatshirt) and vice versa, which projects match which fabrics.

project2.title: Textile Guide srv
project2.titleDescription: Data management API for Textile Guide
project2.description: Textile Guide srv is the backend API for the Textile Guide project, built with Strapi, a Headless CMS. This API manages all data related to fabrics and sewing projects, providing a flexible and extensible interface for content management. It facilitates seamless communication between the front-end and the database, ensuring that users can efficiently search, filter, and match fabrics with sewing projects. Textile Guide srv also handles user management, permissions, and data validation, making the application secure and robust.

project3.title: Moon Weather
project3.titleDescription: Web application for shared housing management
project3.description: Moon Weather is a mobile application that allows users to check the Moon's weather forecast. The application is developed with React Native, using Tailwind CSS for styling and TypeScript for robust and typed programming. It uses the WeatherApi API to retrieve weather data, providing an informative and fun user experience.

project4.title: Coloc&Co
project4.titleDescription: Web application for shared housing management
project4.description: Coloc&Co is a web application designed to simplify daily management and communication within a shared housing environment. The application is built using the MVC (Model-View-Controller) architecture, clearly separating business logic, presentation, and database interactions. The backend is developed with Node.js and Express.js, utilizing PostgreSQL for data management, offering a robust and scalable solution. The frontend is created with React, providing a responsive user experience, while SCSS is used for styling, enabling a modern and modular design.
